required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Etelcalcetide to Treat Secondary Hyperparathyroidism in Hemodialysis Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease-Mineral and Bone Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Open-label, Multicenter, Dose Titration Study of KAI-4169 to Treat Secondary Hyperparathyroidism in Hemodialysis Subjects With Chronic Kidney Disease-Mineral and Bone Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of thrice weekly intravenous (IV) administration of etelcalcetide in the treatment of secondary hyperparathyroidism (SHPT) in hemodialysis patients with chronic kidney disease-mineral and bone disorder (CKD-MBD).

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Parathyroid Hormone (PTH) During the Efficacy Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and the efficacy period, defined as from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug (approximately days 68 - 85 for participants who completed 12 weeks of treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the average of 3 predialysis PTH results obtained within 3 weeks of and prior to the first dose of study drug. The efficacy period (defined as the period from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug) value was the mean of the prehemodialysis values obtained during that period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With ≥ 30% Reduction in PTH From Baseline During the Efficacy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and the efficacy period, defined as from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug (approximately days 68 - 85 for participants who completed 12 weeks of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The efficacy period (defined as the period from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug) value was the mean of the prehemodialysis values obtained during that period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With PTH ≤ 300 pg/mL During the Efficacy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The efficacy period, defined as from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug (approximately days 68 - 85 for participants who completed 12 weeks of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The efficacy period (defined as the period from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug) value was the mean of the prehemodialysis values obtained during that period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Corrected Calcium During the Efficacy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and the efficacy period, defined as from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug (approximately days 68 - 85 for participants who completed 12 weeks of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the average of 3 predialysis PTH results obtained within 3 weeks of and prior to the first dose of study drug. The efficacy period (defined as the period from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug) value was the mean of the prehemodialysis values obtained during that period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Phosphorus During the Efficacy Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and the efficacy period, defined as from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug (approximately days 68 - 85 for participants who completed 12 weeks of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the average of 3 predialysis PTH results obtained within 3 weeks of and prior to the first dose of study drug. The efficacy period (defined as the period from 14 days prior to and 3 days after the last dose of study drug) value was the mean of the prehemodialysis values obtained during that period.

arm_group.description: Participants received etelcalcetide three times a week (TIW) administered by intravenous bolus injection at the end of each hemodialysis session for 12 weeks. The starting dose was 5 mg and may have been titrated every 4 weeks based on the preceding serum parathyroid hormone (PTH) and corrected calcium (cCa) levels to a maximum dose of 20 mg per hemodialysis session in order to achieve the targeted PTH range while maintaining serum calcium within an acceptable range.

intervention.description: Administered 3 times a week by bolus injection into the venous line of the dialysis circuit after the end of hemodialysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects provides written informed consent
- Screening intact PTH (iPTH) ≥ 350 pg/mL and corrected calcium ≥ 8.5 mg/dL
- Hemoglobin ≥ 8.5 g/dL
- Serum transaminases (alanine transaminase [ALT], aspartate transaminase [AST]) less than 2.5 times the upper limit of normal
- Adequate hemodialysis three times per week
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or symptomatic ventricular dysrhythmias
- History of angina pectoris or congestive heart failure
- History of myocardial infarction, coronary angioplasty, or coronary artery bypass grafting within the past 6 months
- History of or treatment for seizure disorder within the last 12 months
- Postdialysis systolic blood pressure > 180 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 90 mmHg
- Serum magnesium below the lower limit of normal at screening

clinical_study.keyword: Chronic kidney disease-mineral and bone disorder

condition_browse.mesh_term: Chronic Kidney Disease-Mineral and Bone Disorder

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 5 centers in the United States from 05 December 2011 (first participant enrolled) to 21 May 2012 (last participant completed follow-up).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multicenter studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
